Review: The fee for BBA for the first years was Rs.80000 and we have to submit it in two parts semester wise. And every year there is a hike of Rs.5000 per annum. So for three years we have to give Rs 255000 and at the time of first fee payment we have to deposit Security Deposit or Caution Money of Rs 15000 and it's refundable at the end of the course. I was not eligible for the scholarship program but Amity offers Scholarship upto 100% also. The college has initiated a great movement where the students who are currently studying in the college Will be able to complete the full course without any fee if any loss of earnings parent happens.

Name: Bhawana Jain
Heading: About my college
Review: I liked Accounting and maths so chooses BCom Honours but as I had other subjects as well I got my interest in marketing so for career choosed marketing. Faculty is good and helpful almost all the faculties have done PhD. The teaching method is also nice. 3 exam sessions were there in 1 semester. The first term, the 2nd term and then the last term. exams are quite easy if you have studied well and paid attention in the lectures.

Name: Sudharsan
College: Sri Krishna Arts and Science College
Heading: SKASC REVIEW
Review: The campus is Anti-ragging and has ranked first in Swachh Bharath. The campus has a great infrastructure facility and provides digital classes. The campus has many extracurricular activities. I have just completed my first year online do not have much information about the events that took place on the campus. The information I could gain from the seniors were there was various fest which took place. There are many clubs like NCC NSS ROTARY and many more. Various sports activities also have been conducted in cricket football and many other sports as well.

Name: Shivam Rawat
Heading: The truth of College Life
Review: I chose this course as it covers every part of commerce and this course helps in all the placement drives and Hons sounds supremacy types. The faculty member qualifications is graduate and the teaching method varies according to teachers, few like to use the blackboard, few dictates, a few give notes, sometimes someone uses ppts, so it varies. Our college is famous for its academics, it's very important and quite strict regarding it too. Term exams were lengthy and used to give proper exam vibes. Exams were conducted many times, we had our midterms exams, then few internal exams and finally final exams. There were kinda easy to pass.

Name: Akil Antony
College: Chennais Amirta International Institute of Hotel Management - [CAIIHM]
Degree_Branch: Executive Diploma, Hotel Management & Catering Science
Heading: Great future
Review: It was so good my brother also studied here now he got placed in Dubai and settled there. Soon I will also be there with the college help only. ITC and Taj I have visited. Name: Priyanka

College: Symbiosis College of Arts and Commerce

In that limited space fests and other cultural activities take place, like Traditional day, Ethnic day where you can wear your traditional outfit of your state. There is an auditorium in Symbiosis Vishwabhawan where such kinds of functions, dandiya nights are organized. So the best part was people from all other states come and become a part of your class and ended up being the best kind of family in these 2 years.

Heading: Many opportunity for internship

Name: Suryakant
Degree_Branch: PG Program, Data Science and Business Analytics
Heading: My Life at Great Learning
Review: The course curriculum at my institutions is designed for working professional by UT Austin-McCombs and Great Lakes. Also, the content that we study is created by faculties of UT Austin, Great Lakes, IIT Bombay, other AI experts, and practising data scientists. The curriculum comprises of data science Foundation in which we are taught about the introduction of data science, marketing and CRM, business finance. Further, data science techniques comprise of data mining, predictive modeling, advance statistics, others and domain exposure consists of web & social media analytics, supply chain & logistics analytics, marketing & retain analytics, and others. Apart from this, our faculty helps us in building resume, clearing mock interviews so that we can boost our confidence level and clear the professional interview very easily. Moreover, the faculty members are highly qualified and experienced as well. And their pedagogy is quite different with modern techniques. Also, one-to-one interaction with industry experts are organized in which they guide us for fair career. In total, there are 20 plus faculties and more than 1300 industry mentors visit our campus to impart conceptual as well as practical knowledge.

Name: vivek prasad
Heading: Best college in GGSIPU
Review: The fess of the whole BBA program is found  3 to 3.5 lakhs for 3 years. the fee doesn't change much. It remains around 1 lakh per year. You can estimate the cost of study around 4 lakh approximately including all the expenses. Yes, fees are somewhat higher than other colleges but this provides you with a perfect base and knowledge too so it' worth it in the end. The university provides different kinds of scholarships. they keep on forwarding the mails regarding scholarships to all the students so that the eligible students can avail the benefit. I too applied for a scholarship named merit cum means scholarships to all the students so that the eligible students can avail the benefit. They will help you.

Name: Shubham Kumar Jha
Heading: Tour of BIT Sindri , college of dreams
Review: In BIT Sindri there are numerous clubs and organizations. Some of them are technical clube while others are a cultural club. Every year they organize technical and cultural fest in months around January and September respectively. In our college, there is a central library consisting of more than 100000 books. If you are interested in reading novels and literature books , gandhi rachnatmak samiti is a college club having its own library. The classroom capacity is around 65 students. There is a Lecturer Hall and webinar halls like C-51 with a seating capacity of 300+ students. There is a sports club and 3 grounds having a basketball court, football, and cricket pitch for practice. A volleyball court is also there in every hostel and common room in hostels where there is carrom board and television. There is numerous social group for students run by students. Some of them are ARTS Clubs, Gandhi Rachnatmak Samiti, Literary Society, Photography club, Painting wing, Literary Society, Sarjana , NSS, etc....

Name: Aniket chakraborty
Heading: A glimpse of Techno Main Salt Lake by Aniket Chakraborty.
Review:
The Placements are pretty good here in TMSL with 80-80% of the batch getting placed.
The students are eligible for placements from the 6th Semester only with a lot of PPO coming in. 
Many different companies visit the campus 
Core companies like Johnson and Johnson ,Robert Bosch and Honeywel visits. 
Then IT companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, CTS, Deloitte etc visit and they take around 60-65% of the batch.
The highest package of 12LPa was offered by Byjus and Robert Bosch for BDS and Junior Engineer position respectively. 
And the average package is 4 LPA.
I at first want a good placement and after completing my degree want to work for 2-3 years and finally do an MBA from a very good college.

Also if any student gets above 60% in their board's result, That is in 10th and 12th then they are eligible to get a scholarship facility too. We get a chance to do an internship from the 5th semester onwards and after graduation, we are also offered proper placements in any reputable organizations too. Name: Nikhil Singh
College: IIT Madras - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITM]
Heading: Heaven on Earth ( IIT Madras )
Review: Placements are awesome in EE and CSE department. Most of the students in these two branches gets placed in intial two days of the placement season. And on an average EE students gets approximately 20 lacs in MTech ( If only SPCOM is considered than my batch average was 25 lacs --> 15 students in SPCOM) VLSI students average was 21 lacs ( Total 25 students are there in VLSI and ICS ) rest are lower branch students but they also bagged around 15 to 20 lacs). Almost 90% students in EE and CSE department gets the job.

Name: Priyanshu Tomar
College: Dr. Akhilesh Das Gupta Institute of Technology & Management - [ADGITM]
Heading: All you want to know about my college!!
Review:
1.) Course curriculum and faculty members are all good and Frank with students.

2.) I choose civil engineering becoz since school i.e, 11th class, I have an interest in engineering graphics, and then I choose this course another reason for choosing this course is that I want to do government jobs and there is a vast scope of government jobs in civil engineering.

3.) Faculty(s) are enough, to handle a class of 60 students.

4.) Most of the faculty are having master's degrees i.e., M.tech in their field and some faculty are PH.D for example faculty of communication skills is a Ph.D. holder. And all faculty teaches very gently and makes students all concepts clear.

5.) There are internal exams twice a semester and then external exams which are finals for the semester. The exam wasn't tough for one who study decently.

Name: Shubham Kumar Jha
Heading: Tour of BIT Sindri , college of dreams
Review: In BIT Sindri there are numerous clubs and organizations. Some of them are technical clube while others are a cultural club. Every year they organize technical and cultural fest in months around January and September respectively. In our college, there is a central library consisting of more than 100000 books. If you are interested in reading novels and literature books , gandhi rachnatmak samiti is a college club having its own library. The classroom capacity is around 65 students. There is a Lecturer Hall and webinar halls like C-51 with a seating capacity of 300+ students. There is a sports club and 3 grounds having a basketball court, football, and cricket pitch for practice. A volleyball court is also there in every hostel and common room in hostels where there is carrom board and television. There is numerous social group for students run by students. Some of them are ARTS Clubs, Gandhi Rachnatmak Samiti, Literary Society, Photography club, Painting wing, Literary Society, Sarjana , NSS, etc....

Name: Aniket chakraborty
Heading: A glimpse of Techno Main Salt Lake by Aniket Chakraborty.
Review:
The Placements are pretty good here in TMSL with 80-80% of the batch getting placed.
The students are eligible for placements from the 6th Semester only with a lot of PPO coming in. 
Many different companies visit the campus 
Core companies like Johnson and Johnson ,Robert Bosch and Honeywel visits. 
Then IT companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, CTS, Deloitte etc visit and they take around 60-65% of the batch.
The highest package of 12LPa was offered by Byjus and Robert Bosch for BDS and Junior Engineer position respectively. 
And the average package is 4 LPA.
I at first want a good placement and after completing my degree want to work for 2-3 years and finally do an MBA from a very good college.

Name: Sweety Mondal
Heading: Review from a fresher's perspective
Review: The fees structure here is quite affordable. In a 3 years course time, the fee that I have to pay is around 2.8 lakhs which according to me is very much affordable. The fees structure includes tution fees, examination fees, library fees too. In case of any student who wants to study by taking a loan, our university provides education loan assistance too. Also if any student gets above 60% in their board's result, That is in 10th and 12th then they are eligible to get a scholarship facility too. We get a chance to do an internship from the 5th semester onwards and after graduation, we are also offered proper placements in any reputable organizations too. Since I'm in the 2nd semester so I did not get any placement from campus yet.

Name: Mayank Jain
Heading: Internship Opportunities For Students
Review: I prefered IT because of my interest in programming which I developed during my school days and also there are more opportunities in computer science-related fields as compared to any other because of growing automation core jobs are declining. The faculty-student ratio is good here. Teachers are always available to take doubts of students, soft skills classes are an integral part of the curriculum in which students interact and debate with teachers on a lot of issues. Also, it helps in the overall development of one's personality. Webinars and workshops are also organised by the college in the first year to make students comfortable about college life. Faculty are highly qualified mostly have done their post-grad from IITs and NITs.Many have done PhDs from Govt. colleges. Therefore, they have a strong grasp of their concepts. Exams are not that difficult if one focuses during class lectures he/she will be able to score good and exams are organised timely with 2 CTs and 1 PUE every semester.

College: IIT Madras - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITM]

Name: Vatsla
College: Prin. L. N. Welingkar Institute of Management Development & Research - [WeSchool]
Heading: The Honest Online We School
Review: I choose Business Design due to its unique curriculum which promotes out-of-the-box thinking. Name: Ayusha Biswas
Heading: Perfect College for every engineering student!Come join Guru Nanak Institute of Technology

Name: Soham Dey Sarkar

Name: Karishma Khan
Heading: About IEM Kolkata

There are clubs running for each of the specialization led by one or two faculty. Each student has to be a part of atleast two clubs and actively participate for successful completion of the degree.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Degree_Branch: B.Tech, Computer Science And Information Technology
Heading: NICE JOURNEY OF KIET
Review: I Choose the BTech course because from childhood my attraction is for computer-related activities very much so that I decided in the 12th class to take admission in engineering and technology. The faculty of KIET college is very kind-hearted and they love their students very much. They always stand for their students and to solve their problems. the relation of faculty and students looks like they are family members and know everything about us. and always ready to solve our issues and any kind of problems. The teachers are the best and they are very well qualified. Some of the teachers have done PhD from a premium institute like IITs. they are very knowledgeable. In KIET total of 4 exams is held in one semester. In which 3 are internals and final one are university exam. Academic is an only good thing and I want to improve my Practical knowledge. If we punctuate and work hard then every exam is simple and we can gain anything that we want.

Name: ishita mirani
College: Prin. L. N. Welingkar Institute of Management Development & Research - [WeSchool]
Heading: My college experience
Review: I chose this course because it merges business design and management together and makes it creative for students to understand. It covers all the dimensions like Marketing, Finance, HR and Operations. 20:60 is the student ratio per semester. The faculty is highly recommended experienced. They cater to every student's needs individually. The teaching method is extremely practical even though it was in virtual mode this year. The exams are easy if the student pays attention to the grooming sessions and lectures. The exams happen thrice in one year.

Name: Arvind
Heading: IIM Sambalpur the 360 view
Review: Campus placement is good as many companies come up with different roles for the batch. @nd trimester of 2nd year is when students start participating in placements. This year our college has recorded the highest package 26 lakhs and a median of 13 lakhs. There has been an increase of 10% in total records and recruiters.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Prime Institute of Engineering and Technology
Heading: The sweet memories
Review: After the commencement of the semester, regular mid exams were conducted and exams were at the university level. Tough the exams were difficult to pass but were helpful for university examination. The faculties were up to date and in required quantity and on behalf of the number of faculties, it was my fortune to have such capable and well-educated faculties. All faculties have the minimum qualification of Masters in engineering.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: Symbiosis Centre for Management and Human Resource Development - [SCMHRD]
Heading: About SCMHRD, Pune
Review: The flagship programme offered at SCMHRD is a 2 Year full-time MBA spread over 4 semesters. Name: Saral Mittal
College: IIT Bombay - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITB]
Heading: Better than expected Experience, [But]lower than expected salaries
Review: I always had a fascination(still have) for mechanical engineering. I feel Faculty:student ratio is appropriate, Professors are available any time students try to reach them, whether it is professional advice or academic advice. Faculties are very highly qualified, almost all the professors have a PhD from internationally reputed universities along with significant post-doc experience. For first year courses(common courses for every department), faculty:student ratio is very low. To overcome the issue Teaching Assistants(TA) are recruited which are either graduate student or senior UG student who had performed exceptionally well in that course. The TAs help the student in their course-related problems during weekly sessions. Overall, the learning experience is not so great for 1st year courses due to many factors- Large batch size during instruction, lack of clarity in instruction and performance-oriented atmosphere particularly intense during the 1st year. In the subsequent years the quality of teaching improves drastically as the students take up the courses in their respective departments. Curriculum and the course content is still a bit outdated, but recently the focus on practical training has improved greatly. The total marks distribution for the courses is distributed across quizzes, mid-term, end-term and course projects, schedule of which is decided by the instructor, mostly at the beginning of the instructions.

each faculty gets only two sections which is a very good thing in the college.

If you prepare a little you can pass easily.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: A good college with well qualified and experienced faculty
Review: The name of the annual fest of the college is Kalakriti and it is held every year in March in which a Punjabi singer comes for the concert and EDM night is also there in this fest. The fests of other departments are also held in Feb and March. There is a library in the college through which you can issue the books but it needs to be improved as some books are old editioned books. There are various sports in the college like hockey, cricket, volleyball, basketball, Kabaddi, etc., and the hockey ground is well maintained and the hockey team of our college is no. 1 in DU. There are many cells and societies in the college.

Name: Krishnansh
Heading: College review
Review:
After the 2nd Semester, students become eligible for campus placements.
There are so many companies visited in the college for placements. 
The highest package is 32 lakh last year.
The percentage doesn't matter for the placements, if you have general knowledge then you are able to qualify for any interview.

Name: Aryan Srivastava
Heading: More Information about College
Review: The course curriculum is well structured with a lot of informative subjects which are necessary for a good understanding of the topics. The teachers here are very helpful and always try to clear each and any doubt any student has either at the end of the class or after college hours. The exams here are usually conducted on time but due to the covid pandemic, there has been some delay recently due to the changing guidelines by the state government. Overall the faculty is good.

Name: Student (Anonymous)
College: IIT Kharagpur - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITKGP]
Heading: KGP is best Institute for Education and Enjoying Life .
Review:
I chose this course because I find this course very interesting and related to daily life activities.
The faculty-student ratio of IIT KGP is very well relative to other IIT's which is 1:19. The students are able to interact with faculties very easily.
The faculties of this institute have a high qualification as most of them are IITians, well-renowned Scientists, Ph.D. ones, etc.
Allocations of the faculty members are well planned in this institute and the Teaching process of them is a bit quite friendly.
They treat students like their friends and classes are held in a very fun manner. Students tell that faculties are very good in terms of explaining the topics and clearing our doubts.
The exams are held continuously like mid-term and end-term examinations. Assignments are held every week for testing students' skills.
The level of exams is quite tougher which we are supposed to give. I myself found it harder to score full marks in exams.

Name: Harshit
Heading: College review
Review: The campus life is really awesome. I mean you get to stay in-between nature and many shopping complexes around and very easy access to metro and bus stations. Food shops and cafes are all nearby. Our college has conducted many fests and events in the past many years. So our college's main fest/event name is MEHAK. That was literally the best event and there were so many students who had participated in it. All fests/events took place in the month of April. Talking about the college library. So it is really well maintained I must say. As such we do not face any unavailability or shortage of books. When it comes to amenities that we get to experience in our classrooms. So I would say those are on an average scale. But we do not have any issues with that. This means, we get to experience and use all the basic things in good condition. The infrastructure of our college is not that good as I was expecting when I entered the college for the first time. But, yes all infrastructure in DU is on an average scale

Name: Sujal agrawal
Heading: Amity university Chhattisgarh
Review: As I was from a business family so I think BBA will help me to grow my business that's why I have chosen this and there are large no. Of faculty and all the faculty are well trained and qualified also in every class of 50 to 55 students at a time 1 teacher will be there and in every semester there will be timely midterm examination and assignment presentation are given and at the end of every semester end term exams will be taken at a regular interval

Name: Student (Anonymous)
Heading: Experience at JIMS Kalkaji
Review: Every year fest is organized by the college in which students get to show their talents. The college will provide you books of your syllabus for every trimester and you can also issue extra books from the library as well. Students who are good at sports also get the opportunity to participate in inter-college sports competitions. Apart from that college has several clubs as per students' interests like marketing, finance, HR, data science, etc.

Name: Ashlesh
College: IIT Kanpur - Indian Institute of Technology - [IITK]
Review: This is the best part of all. You cannot expect a better campus than this. Other IITs also got a nice infrastructure but as they are between the metropolitan cities they lack the space to expand. But IITK is 15 kms from Kanpur City and they have ample amount of space available. The campus is a lush green with nice architectural buildings open and green spaces. A lot of peacocks can be seen here and there.

Name: Yash garg
Heading: First come first serve
Review: Because I love to do marketing and explore new innovative ideas to make it more creative for me. In this campus, all the facilities members are very well trained as per their posts and their teaching method is superb because after each and every concept they'll give a brief example so the student can understand it properly. 2 hours will be given to us for our exams the pattern of the exam is from easy to difficult so I must say if we have studied it properly then it will be easy for each one of us to crack it and succeed with a very good percentage.

Name: ABHAY PRATAP SINGH
Heading: Best in best KIPM is best
Review:
The last semester of pharmacy students is eligible for campus jobs.
Cadila, Cipla, Ranbaxy,.pharmasynth, and many more companies are visited and a maximum number of pharmacy students are get offered.
3.20 lacs/ annum highest and 1.80 lacs/ annum lowest.
About 95% of students are placed.
For higher education.

Name: Shiva Manchala
Heading: My experience and my knowledge about my college.
Review: The placements of our college are not that much great. They're okay. We only get some placements. We will get placements in our final year. The students who have no backlogs and who have the minimum percentage of 60-65 are eligible for campus placements. The companies like  TCS, cognizant, Amazon, Tech Mahindra, Genpact, HCL, etc will come to our campus. The highest package will be 4l to per annum and the least will be 2l per annum. the students from 7 semesters are eligible for placements. My plan after getting my degree is to place in a reputed company and now I'm actually doing work this year.
